metadata.Title: CVE-2021-20225 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in grub2 in versions prior to 2.06. The option parser allows an attacker to write past the end of a heap-allocated buffer by calling certain commands with a large number of specific short forms of options. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity as well as system availability. It was discovered that the option parser in GRUB 2 contained a heap overflow vulnerability. A local attacker could use this to execute arbitrary code and bypass UEFI Secure Boot restrictions.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-20225` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

grub-efi-amd64-signed - 1.167.2
grub-efi-arm64-signed - 1.167.2
No subscription required

grub-efi-amd64 - 2.04-1ubuntu44.2
grub-efi-amd64-bin - 2.04-1ubuntu44.2
grub-efi-arm64 - 2.04-1ubuntu44.2
grub-efi-arm64-bin - 2.04-1ubuntu44.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> grub2-unsigned will contain fixes and supersede grub2, which will contain only BIOS grub bits.

criterions.comment: grub2 package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
grub2-signed package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.167.2').
grub2-unsigned package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.04-1ubuntu44.2').
